page.title: 04Royal Naval Store Depot
page.content: The Depot occupies a site of approximately 80 acres which was formerly part of the Exeter Golf and Country Club. It was built in 1944 during the Second World War by an American support unit for use in the preparation for the D Day landings. The Depot currently employs about a 100 people and stores electrical and general goods. They are mainly used by the Royal Navy for its transport and general needs. Stores arrive by road and are checked in one shed and then delivered to appropriate stores. Ships put in their requisitions for stores which are then packed and delivered by National Carriers, Navy vehicles, by rail or air.
